anl.verdi.plot.util

Class WriteAnimatedGif

  • java.lang.Object
    • anl.verdi.plot.util.WriteAnimatedGif

  • public class WriteAnimatedGif
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates an animated GIF from GIF frames. A thin wrapper to code written by other people, as documented on the thread on the Sun forums 'Create animated GIF using imageio' http://forums.sun.com/thread.jspa?threadID=5395006 See the printUsage() method for details on parameters required.
    Author:
    Andrew Thompson

        public void saveAnimate(java.io.File file,

               int delayTime)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        See http://forums.sun.com/thread.jspa?messageID=9988198
        Parameters:
        file - File A File in which to store the animation.
        frames - BufferedImage[] Array of BufferedImages, the frames of the animation.
        delayTime - String String, representing the frame delay time (in centiseconds)

        Parameters:
        index - int, Index of frame being added to GIF (Zero Based)
        frame - BufferedImage, the frame of the animation.
        delayTime - String, representing the frame delay time (in centiseconds)
        Throws:

      • checkDelay

        public static java.lang.String checkDelay(java.lang.String delay)
        Checks that a String intended as a delayTime is an integer>0. If not, dumps a warning message and the usage, then exits. If successful, returns the String unaltered.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Parse the arguments and if successful, attempt to write the animated GIF.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
